raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
Another way to think about radiation dose is through the dose profile measured over multiple circular scans.

When you perform one circular scan, you get a certain dose distribution.
If you then do a second circular scan, youâ€™ll get a similar dose profile again.
When multiple scans are performed, each scan adds its own dose profile.

These multiple dose profiles overlap, contributing to the total radiation dose the patient receives.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "Radiation Dose from Multiple Scans Are Accumulated in the Central Slice",
      "p": "represents",
      "o": "Real profile",
      "modalities": [
        "text",
        "image"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "Radiation Dose from Multiple Scans Are Accumulated in the Central Slice"
    }
  ]
}
